intro: Selago wittebergensis, commonly known as the Witteberg sandburs, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive bracts and small yellow flowers. The plant is typically found in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in arid environments. It has a low-growing habit with a fibrous root system, allowing it to survive in harsh conditions. Selago wittebergensis plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small insects and animals.
